member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS
member.summary: The CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS structure contains information about a Certificate Trust List (CTL) returned by.

member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the structure. The application calling sets this parameter. If cbSize is not greater than or equal to the required size of the structure, CertVerifyCTLUsage returns FALSE and returns E_INVALIDARG.

member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS.dwError
member.summary: The error status, if any, returned by the call to . For the list of possible error values, see the Return Values section in CertVerifyCTLUsage.

member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS.dwFlags
member.summary: If CERT_VERIFY_UPDATED_CTL_FLAG is returned, updated a CTL whose time was no longer valid with a new, time-valid CTL.

summary.para: Pointer to a pointer to a CTL context containing the matched subject. The calling application can set this pointer to NULL to indicate that a CTL containing the subject is not to be returned.
If ppCtl is not NULL, the calling application must free the returned context using .

member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS.dwCtlEntryIndex
member.summary: Returns the array location of the matching subject's entry in the CTL's array.

summary.para: A pointer to a pointer to the certificate context of the signer of the CTL. This pointer can be set to NULL by the calling application indicating that the certificate of the signer of the CTL is not to be returned.
If ppSigner is not NULL, the calling application must free the returned context using .

member.name: CTL_VERIFY_USAGE_STATUS.dwSignerIndex
member.summary: Index of the signer actually used. Needed if a message has more than one signer.
